predictions.report:
April 8th, 1957:

Seventeen tornadoes struck the Southern US. Officially, 15 of these were significant (F2+). A long-track F4 (likely a tornado family) ripped through several South & North Carolina counties. A second F4 slammed Pembroke, NC. Seven people were killed.
